**Waste Management - What is the Real Deal?**

unnormalised: So, I was just reading an article about how much garbage Mumbai generates every single day - apparently, it's enough to cover several football fields! It got me thinking... are we *really* doing enough about waste management here in India?

I mean, we've all seen the piles of trash overflowing near marketplaces like Crawford Market, right? And how many times have we heard about the Deonar dumping ground fires choking the city? It's a serious issue!
normalised: So, I was just reading an article about how much garbage Mumbai generates every single day - apparently, it is enough to cover several football fields! It got me thinking... are we *really* doing enough about waste management here in India?

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from IIT Delhi gave a talk I attended a few months ago, and he mentioned that a massive portion of our waste isn't even segregated properly. Imagine all the plastic bottles, food scraps, and other recyclable materials just ending up in landfills. Think about the land pollution and health risks!
